benchmark_details.name: BIG5-C HAT
benchmark_details.overview: BIG5-C HAT is a large-scale dataset containing 100,000 dialogues designed to ground models in how humans express their personality in language, addressing realism and validity issues in prior methods.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate how training-based methods grounded in real human data compare to traditional prompting techniques for inducing personality traits in LLMs.

data.source: Combination of PsychGenerator and SODA datasets.
data.annotation: Generated text based on personality traits using fine-tuned models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on personality assessments using BFI and IPIP-NEO.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with human-like personality traits.
methodology.validation: Human evaluations were conducted comparing generated outputs with baseline methods.
